meanings.definition: A pivoted bar engaging with the teeth of a wheel or rack, used to prevent backward movement.
meanings.sent1: The pawls clicked into place, stopping the wheel from turning backwards.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic adjusted the pawls on the gear to ensure the machine stayed in position.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use the pawls to stop the acorn from rolling away.
meanings.sent4: Her determination acted like the pawls, preventing her from sliding back into old habits.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the pawls locking echoed through the room, signaling the end of the game.
meanings.sent6: After the hike, the pawls on the gate kept it securely closed.
meanings.sent7: The old wooden door creaked as the pawls latched onto the frame.
meanings.sent8: The mischievous cat tried to play with the pawls on the gate, thinking they were toys.
meanings.sent9: The pawls on the gate held firm, like a loyal friend refusing to let go.
meanings.sent10: With a loud clack, the pawls secured the gate, ensuring no one could enter without permission.
